did.unittitle: Amie Karp collection of tobacciana
did.abstract: The Amie Karp Collection of Tobacciana consists of a variety of 19th and 20th century tobacco-related ephemera and reference material.

arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in three series by format:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Amie Karp Collection of Tobacciana is mainly comprised of 19th and 20th century tobacco-related ephemera. It includes cigar bands, cigar box labels, tobacco tags, cigarette boxes, cigarette cards, and tobacco pouches. The ephemera is variously mounted on boards, sleeved, and displayed in scrapbooks. The collection also contains printed catalogs advertising cigar and cigarette cards, tags, labels, boxes and bands. Many of the catalogs include instructions for claiming prizes in exchange for these items. Ten reference books about tobacco, tobacco ephemera, and collecting tobacciana are also included.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional tobacciana material can be found in the following collections:
PR 31 Bella C. Landauer Collection of Business and Advertising Ephemera
PR 241 Sidney Voice Collection of Cigar Bands

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Additional tobacciana material donated by Amie Karp can be found in New-York Historical's museum collections.

scopecontent.p: This series includes cigar bands, cigar box labels, tobacco tags, cigarette boxes, cigarette cards, and tobacco pouches. The ephemera is variously mounted on boards, sleeved, and displayed in scrapbooks.

scopecontent.p: Reliance Cigar Co. box of lithographed, accordion folded, glassine and card stock single cigar protectors for pocket portage. Illustrated on front and back with a burning cigar.

did.unittitle: Cigarette Boxes
Scrapbooks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Cigar Bands" - two volumes of specialty collector books with slotted pages filled with cigar bands. Both volumes are inscribed "Annie L. Taff" in pen on the inside front cover; one volume is also marked "Fred A. Taff." 1878-1905.
"White Knight" - child's collection of 420 cigar bands in a notebook, 1900-1906.
"Estemento Superiores" - a child named Ward Heinzman's collection of 351 cigar bands (along with some postage stamps) in a ledger book, 1908.
"Wills Cigarette Picture-Card Album of Household Hints," 1936.
